terms.value: Key Laboratory of Environment and Disease-Related Gene, Ministry of Education/Department of Cell Biology and Genetics, School of Basic Medical Sciences, Xi’an Jiaotong University, Health Science Center

description: 0.005). We identified three upregulated peaks (peaks 2, 8 and 9) and six downregulated peaks (peaks 1, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7) in samples from PC patients, compared with HC samples. Interestingly, one peptide demonstrated the most significant changes between PC and HC samples, which we identified as regions of RNA-binding motif protein 6 (RBM6). In subsequent tissue analysis, we verified RBM6 expression was significantly higher in PC tissues than paracancerous tissue. Our results indicate that RBM6 might serve as a candidate diagnostic biomarker for PC.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Pancreatic cancer, Proteomics, Serum biomarker, RBM6

modifications.name: No PTMs are included in the dataset

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Duan B, Hu X, Fan M, Xiong X, Han L, Wang Z, Tong D, Liu L, Wang X, Li W, Yang J, Huang C. RNA-Binding Motif Protein 6 is a Candidate Serum Biomarker for Pancreatic Cancer. Proteomics Clin Appl. 2019 Sep;13(5):e1900048.

title: RNA-Binding Motif protein 6 is a candidate serum biomarker for pancreatic cancer
